A: The problem is that you are not specifying the character set when writing the text. By default, Java uses the platform's default character set, which can cause problems with non-ASCII characters.

You can specify the character set by using the `write(byte[] b, int off, int len, String charsetName)` method of `DataOutputStream`.

Here is how you can modify your `buildTextPart` method:

```java
private void buildTextPart(DataOutputStream dataOutputStream, String parameterName, String parameterValue) throws IOException {
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes("Content-Disposition: form-data; name=" + parameterName + lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes("Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8" + lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
    dataOutputStream.write(parameterValue.getBytes("UTF-8"));
    dataOutputStream.writeBytes(lineEnd);
}
```

This will ensure that the text is written in UTF-8 encoding, which should correctly handle any non-ASCII characters.

Note: The `getBytes("UTF-8")` method returns a byte array that represents the string in UTF-8 encoding. The `write` method then writes these bytes to the `DataOutputStream`.

This should solve your problem.

Please replace `"UTF-8"` with your desired character set if it's different.

Also, ensure that the `parameterValue` string is properly encoded in UTF-8 before passing it to this method. If it's coming from a user input, make sure it's properly encoded before you pass it to this method.

If you're still having issues, please provide more details about the error you're encountering.
